definition: setback/reverse/check/defeat/frustration/disappointment/to frustrate/to discourage/to set sb back/to blunt/to subdue
obstructed/to fail/to oppress/to repress/to lower the tone/to bend back/to dampen
to break (e.g. stick or bone)/a loss
to turn sth over/to turn upside down/to tip sth out (of a container)

to break/to fracture/to snap/to suffer loss/to bend/to twist/to turn/to change direction/convinced/to convert into (currency)/discount/rebate/tenth (in price)/classifier for theatrical scenes/to fold/accounts book

sentences.english: Learn how to handle setbacks. Life is made of ups, downs, and disappointments.
sentences.chinese: 学会如何处理挫折，生活由顺利，挫折和失望构成。

sentences.english: Learn how to handle setbacks. Life is made of ups, downs, and disappointments.
sentences.chinese: 学会如何处理挫折，生活由顺利，挫折和失望构成。

sentences.english: And Lin Bicheng exorbitant is conceited, meet with repeatedly setback.
sentences.chinese: 而林必成过分的自负，屡遭挫折。

sentences.english: So how did we survive those three years of setbacks?
sentences.chinese: 我们是如何承受住那三年的挫折呢？

sentences.english: Completely recovered from an illness or set-back.
sentences.chinese: 从病或挫折中完全恢复。

sentences.english: Her male cousins had hardly prepared her for a contretemps with a man she desired.
sentences.chinese: 就她想要的男人，她的男表亲不希望她有挫折。

sentences.english: Mum suggests that I should cheer up when meeting with setbacks.
sentences.chinese: 妈妈建议我在遇到挫折时应振奋起来。

sentences.english: Don't beat a retreat immediately after any setback, at least you should make another attempt to hit it.
sentences.chinese: 不要一遇到挫折就打退堂鼓，至少你应该再试一次。

sentences.english: Ideality, laught at every frustrations beside.
Bad days generally occur when a number of little frustrations happen in succession.
sentences.chinese: 糟糕的日子通常出现于当一连串小挫折连续发生时。

sentences.english: We have seen some early successes and also some frustrations.
sentences.chinese: 我们看到了一些初期的成功，也经历了一些挫折。

sentences.english: The assessment work seems to have discouraged this type of airborne survey.
sentences.chinese: 普查工作似乎会使这种类型的航测遭到挫折。

sentences.english: These setbacks should not be read as defeat, however.
sentences.chinese: 但是，这些挫折不能简单的看成是失败。

sentences.english: But it was overshadowed by the much bigger setback Mr Obama had suffered a few days earlier.
sentences.chinese: 但是这并不能弥补奥巴马在前几天遭受到的挫折。

sentences.english: They gloat at his legislative setbacks.
sentences.chinese: 这些人对他在立法机关所受的挫折幸灾乐祸。

sentences.english: The defeat constitutes a major set-back for our diplomacy.
sentences.chinese: 这一失败是我们外交上的重大挫折。

definition: to thwart/to foil (sb's plans)/a setback/a failure/a defeat
bumpy (of a road)/rough (of life)/to be down on one's luck/to be full of frustrations and dashed hopes
propitious wind throughout the journey (idiom)/plain sailing/to go smoothly/have a nice trip!
to be defeated/to lose/to fail (e.g. experiments)/failure/defeat/CL:次[ci4]
